channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Blocking pavement, 24th December
item.description:
I have spoken to the resident of that property and nobody knows whose van it is apparently but yeah, it’s parked in their driveway and blocking pedestrians access to the pavement

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 104, Charlton Road, Ponders End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Exposed Electrical Components in Streetlight Column, 24th December
item.description:
The access panel at the base of a streetlight column is missing or open, leaving internal electrical components and wiring fully exposed. This presents a potential safety hazard to pedestrians, particularly children, and may also pose a risk of water ingress or vandalism-related damage. The issue is located on a pedestrian island at a road junction and should be inspected and secured as a priority.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westgate Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping - hazardous, 24th December
item.description:
In situ for several days .. of particular concern is that Hackney operatives declined to remove broken mirror placed deliberately upright against wall to cause risk of serious injury

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southwold Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: At junction of Kidderpore Avenue with Finchley Road, 24th December
item.description:
The green cast iron litter bin has been lifted from the paving slab on which it is standing. The bin needs to be re cemented.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidderpore Gardens, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Windmill Hill, Greater London

item.category: Graffiti (Offensive or up to 2 meters off the ground)

item.title: Near 53 Hollycroft Avenue, 24th December
item.description:
Ceramic tiles in sign have become loose and are at risk of falling out. They need to be cemented back into the frame. They are expensive handmade tiles and are important to the Conservation Area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hollycroft Avenue, West Hampstead, Greater London

item.title: Sundry fly tipped rubbish, 24th December
item.description:

item.title: Zebra crossing by wattisfield Road bus stop is dangerous, 24th December
item.description:
There is a zebra crossing between the bus stop and pavement over the cycle lane. It is a blind spot for the pedestrian trying to cross from bus stop side. I nearly got hit by an e bike as was unable to see around the bus shelter onto the bike path.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lea Bridge Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of dumped waste in the street, 24th December
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ambleside Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins, 24th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Footbury Hill Road, Poverest, Greater London
